title: Iran’s Khamenei warns of ‘crushing’ response to Israeli strikes
description: Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei did not explicitly say an attack would originate from Iran, adding to speculation Tehran plans to retaliate from neighboring Iraq.
author: Adam Taylor, Mustafa Salim, Bryan Pietsch, Suzan Haidamous, Heidi Levine
byline: Adam Taylor, Mustafa Salim, Bryan Pietsch, Suzan Haidamous, Heidi Levine
excerpt: Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei did not explicitly say an attack would originate from Iran, adding to speculation Tehran plans to retaliate from neighboring Iraq.
text: TEL AVIV — Iran’s supreme leader vowed Saturday to give a “crushing response” to Israel’s attacks on Iranian military and missile defense sites, saying they would “not go unanswered” and hinting at a potential role for Iranian-backed groups in any reprisal.The comments by Ayatollah Ali Khamenei before an audience in Tehran were the leader’s most direct yet on whether he would order a response to Israel’s strikes on Oct. 26. Israeli officials have signaled in recent days that they believe Iran is preparing to retaliate, citing intelligence.
html:
TEL AVIV — Iran’s supreme leader vowed Saturday to give a “crushing response” to Israel’s attacks on Iranian military and missile defense sites, saying they would “not go unanswered” and hinting at a potential role for Iranian-backed groups in any reprisal.

The comments by Ayatollah Ali Khamenei before an audience in Tehran were the leader’s most direct yet on whether he would order a response to Israel’s strikes on Oct. 26. Israeli officials have signaled in recent days that they believe Iran is preparing to retaliate, citing intelligence.
